description:

Your host Michelle Michels has updates, interviews and stories about climate change, conservation, indigenous perspectives on land management, ecology, energy and sustainability topics. Local, national and international topics are discussed. Local communities, academics, activists and anyone concerned about the environment speak about their concerns and projects. 
 Included is the project on Modern Slavery legislation in Australia, kindly funded by the Community Broadcasting Foundation. Written and produced by Michelle Michels in collaboration with Jodee Sydney (aired on Bay FM 'Eco Futures' from June 2020 - March 2021).  
Weekly program broadcast on www.bayfm.org 11 am -12 pm Wednesdays available online https://www.bayfm.org//shows/eco-futures/

title: With One Tied Hand - The Buffalo Soldiers of World War II
description:
Though veterans of the United States of America liberated others worldwide at immense sacrifice, a little told American story is the unique liberation of the Tuscan people by the Buffalo Soldiers of WWII. After the War ended, these courageous men were sent home to a 'Jim Crow' America. 

Italian history is strikingly different. The impoverished, starving Tuscans feel as if they owe their lives to the Buffalo Soldiers, whom they lovingly dubbed 'Giganti Buoni' (Good Giants). An Italian eyewitness said, “They came down the mountain and freed us, and took care of us.” 

Ivan J. Houston, who was himself wounded in WWII, served in the Segregated 92nd Infantry Division, which bravely fought and pushed the German Nazis and Italian Fascists back behind  The Gothic Line. Tragically, these "Black Warriors" were also forced to fight the U.S. Army’s institutionalized racism, and even individual racist White officers who did not want them to succeed.

“That was just the way the Army was,” says Mr. Houston, retired CEO of America’s third largest African American-owned corporation. 

Between 1945 and 2011, Mr. Houston returned many times to Italy, meeting the Pope, revisiting his battlefields of old, and honoring his fallen comrades at the Florence-American Cemetery. Then, after writing the book, "Black Warriors: The Buffalo Soldiers of WWII, with Gordon Cohn, Mr. Houston was introduced by chance to many, many Italian Reenactors who treated him with warmth and respect. Through the hospitality of a gracious Italian woman, Mattea Piazzesi, a unique bond was formed between two families, the Houston's and the Piazzesi's. Ms Piazzesi had discovered Mr. Houston via his book.

Mr. Houston investigated missing casualty records with the help of local historians, who found the culprit was General Edward Almond, the racist commander (a fact acknowledged by the U.S. War College), who sent an African American Regiment into deadly battle without warning them to expect a heavy Nazi attack. This caused heavy casualties, which Almond then covered up. 

The documentary film, "With One Tied Hand" tells the stirring story of how Tuscan gratitude is finally shown to Mr. Houston, who on behalf of all Buffalo Soldiers is paraded and celebrated on a loving, yearly reenactment of the Liberation of Lucca, the 500-year-old walled city. The film also reveals moving personal stories from surviving eyewitnesses and their families. 

“I think this is the only instance in history where African-Americans have liberated another people,” Mr. Houston concludes.
author_name: Joe and Dayle Hartnett, Director & Producer of With One Tied Hand

title: In den Archiven gefunden
description: Bislang nicht zu Wort gekommene Zeitzeugen, neue Perspektiven, Zahlen und Fakten. Schicksale, Begebenheiten und die immer wiederkehrende Frage – haben wir Menschen aus der Geschichte etwas gelernt? All dies und mehr jeden Dienstag ab 10 Uhr. Der Podcast ist Teil des „Archives, Research and Digitization“ Programm des Pilecki-Instituts Berlin. In Zusammenarbeit mit u.a. dem Bundesarchiv werden unbekannte oder nur schwer verfügbare Dokumente und Quellen erschlossen und digitalisiert. Ziel ist, diese der akademischen Welt zur Verfügung zu stellen, aber auch die aus dem Archivgut gewonnenen Erkenntnisse in die Öffentlichkeit zu tragen. Letzterem Anspruch wollen wir nun u.a. durch unsere neue Podcast-Reihe „In den Archiven gefunden“ gerecht werden.

With our respective backgrounds in Business Intelligence Analytics and Journalism, we engage in inspiring conversations about our experiences in the United States and how people from East Asia navigate their paths in another culture. We discuss how the differences help shape our daily lives - from school to job, and everything in between.

title: GEEZERS GRIEF
description:
After tragically losing our Dad to Cancer in 2018, we have encountered many challenges over time. One of the biggest, has been our stuggles with mental health.

As 'Geezers', we often keep our thoughts and feelings in our own head. This, through our experience, is probably the worst way to combat mental health issues. We have found that by opening our mouths and our minds to others, we can find peace and positivity in the darkest of times.

So in 2020, we smashed our heads together and decided to start this podcast in the hope it gets some Geezers to open up!

Let's get talkin, because people listen!​

If you enjoyed and want to hear other guest's stories, or even be a guest?! Feel free to subscribe, share and reach out.

Tom & Mason

title: Parks
description:
A podcast on the truth about the creation of U.S. National Parks, retold by Indigenous voices.

Parks is about the Indigenous people who lived, hunted, and created communities on U.S. public lands, living reciprocally with nature for centuries before settler-colonists arrived. It’s about the racism, violence, and lies perpetrated by colonizers and the federal government as they dispossessed land from Native people not long ago.

On this podcast, you'll hear Indigenous perspectives on what’s happening to the land now, and what they hope for tomorrow.

Parks asks you to take a new look at our beloved natural spaces — including their conflicted pasts and their uncertain futures.

title: WJFF - Close to Home with Leif Johansen
description: A twenty-something armchair policy wonk born and raised in the Catskills is heading out into the world, and he's got a lot of questions. In this podcast from WJFF Radio Catskill, we'll take a deep dive into the institutions in upstate New York that are at the foundation of our community and explore how they work (and how they sometimes don't). We'll sit down with educators, farmers, public servants, artists, business owners, and all-around do-gooders to learn what it means to be a part of rural America today--and the part each of us can play in creating a brighter future tomorrow.

title: Down To Earth
description: Climate change tends to trigger strong emotions. There is a lot of noise surrounding the concept. It’s complex, abstract but the impact is very real and every single person on planet Earth is concerned. The story tends to be pretty gloomy but four keen Imperial College beans pursuing a master in Climate Change, Management and Finance decided to shift the narrative. Down to Earth is a podcast which aims at reuniting people on our power to act together. Through different episodes, Danielle, Marie, Chris and Anne-Laure go beyond the infuriating climate news and critically look at how sustainability is approached in different local contexts. Curiosity and climate justice are at the very heart of this podcast. We believe a better understanding of different and unknown realities allows for a stronger collective action on climate change.
author_name: Danielle Miranda Leibu, Marie Neveu, Anne-Laure Rajaona, Chris van Der Merwe

title: Dear Houston — Love, Asian America
description:
Storytelling is a powerful and beautiful art form that transcends language, space, and time; through this medium of archival practice, we are connected and inspired by stories passed on through generations. In this podcast, we will be sharing stories from the Asian American community in Houston, where stories collected by oral history interviews at the Houston Asian American Archive (HAAA), are weaved, told, and retold, via a myriad of topics that relate to their intersections with the Asian American identity. HAAA is managed by Rice University's Chao Center for Asian Studies, and located at the Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library. It collects, documents, and preserves the lived experiences of the Asian diaspora in Houston, aiming to develop a broader understanding of history through their lens, which continues to evolve towards the studies of Asia from a transnational perspective.

The series is produced by Ann Shi, Associate Curator, with guidance provided by Dr. Anne Chao, Program Manager and Co-Founder of Houston Asian American Archive, adjunct faculty of School of Humanities, Rice University. Special thanks to Lisa Balabanlilar, Director of Chao Center for Asian Studies, without whose support this series would not have been possible; and thanks to Haejin Koh and Hae Hun Matos for their meticulous organization. Funding is provided by the Houston Asian American Archive and Liu Distinguished Visitor Series, of the Chao Center for Asian Studies, Rice University; with additional support from Dr. Anne Chao, who generously provided her research funding.

This restaurant defied orders to shut down dine-in service during the second lockdown, and they claim it was all to benefit the employees and community. Or were there financial motives? Listen and you decide. 
 
If you love dining-out, or work in the food industry, you don't want to miss this story as it continues in real time as the restaurant faces government opposition even after the lockdown regulations are lifted.

title: Chester is Rising
description:
Arson, break-ins, death threats, the Ku Klux Klan - all tried to stop her.

Zulene Mayfield is a zealous resident whose family is being poisoned by one of the United States’ largest trash incinerators. Her hometown, the city of Chester, Pennsylvania, was invaded by a unique clustering of solid waste facilities in the late eighties and early nineties. Her activism fostered Supreme Court cases which sparked the US environmental justice movement, but after a decade of leading the fight, she vanished in 2001. 

After nearly twenty years of lurking in the shadows, Zulene resurfaces in 2019. She connects with a local podcaster to not only tell her story, but make one thing abundantly clear: she will reclaim Chester’s right to breathe.

description: Alles en iedereen heeft tegenwoordig een podcast. Het middelpunt van het universum kan daarom niet achterblijven. Elke maand krijg jij het Recht voor ze Paap. Dé podcast van de Jordaan, waarin vier Jordanezen, aan de ronde tafel in Café ’t Papeneiland aan de Prinsengracht, het leven in de meest iconische buurt van Nederland bespreken.

title: BreakFree Education
description: Highlights and stories of student success inside juvenile justice facilities. At BreakFree Education, we believe that all children have the right to learn, grow, and dream, so our mission is to radically improve education in the juvenile and criminal justice systems.

title: Last Call with Richard Crouse
description:
Last Call is a podcast on the stories behind the places where everybody knows your name. It's a chance to soak up the ambiance of the world's greatest watering holes without leaving your home.

I’m Richard Crouse. I tended bar for seventeen years everywhere from hot spots to dive bars and I thought I had seen it all.

In my life behind bars I witnessed everything from first dates and marriage proposals to knife fights and a woman who brought a pet monkey in for a drink.

Nothing could surprise me.

Or so I thought.

Then I heard about how a lion who visited Harry’s New York Bar in Paris inspired Ernest Hemingway to write one of his greatest novels. And why there are century old chicken bones hanging above the beer-stained bar at McSorleys in New York City. And how Vincent Sardi refused to do business with the mob during Prohibition, so his famous Broadway Restaurant didn’t serve alcohol until the 21st amendment passed, six year after they first opened.

With the help of the Last Call radio players, music and interviews with cocktail detectives Jared Brown and Anistatia Miller, The Indiana Jones of Tiki, Jeff “Beachbum” Berry and Two and Two: McSorley's, My Dad, and Me author Rafe Bartholomew, I bring these stories, and many more, to life in my podcast Last Call. It’s fact folded in with a sprinkling of fiction, because, well, who doesn’t exaggerate after a few drinks?

So, open that bottle of wine or crack that beer and join me for an intoxicating guided tour of some of the strange stories from some of the world’s best boozers.

title: Werktitel
description: In de kunst wordt veel gesproken over wat mensen doen, maar minder over hoe ze dat doen. In Werktitel buigen Alix de Massiac en Zoë Dankert zich over arbeidsvoorwaarden, netwerken, deadlines, afspraken en collega’s. In een marathon van gesprekken delen mensen verhalen en ervaringen in de hoop een collectief gesprek op gang te brengen. Praten is de eerste stap op weg naar het nieuwe werken; waar ruimte is voor solidariteit en wederkerigheid, waar werken werkbaar is én bespreekbaar. Hoe ziet het nieuwe werken eruit?

title: Just Jay
description: Sometimes in life we go through things that we wouldn’t normally want to, but that’s apart of life. The good and the bad things that we go through are all a part of our journey. Each of us as individuals have our own specific journey. That is what makes our story and our lives different from anyone else. This podcast will be my platform to tell my story and take my audience on my journey through my life, all while healing and growing from my life’s events to make my future brighter. While I use this platform as a form of expression for myself, I will also be speaking on the topics that are often overlooked by today’s society, emphasizing the importance of shedding light on your past for a brighter future, and of course building a relationship with those who discover my podcast and my voice. My loved ones have always told me I have an amazing mind and voice of my own, and they’ve always encouraged me to use it. Now is my time. Welcome to Just Jay, the podcast.

description:
An English Podcast on the Daily Life in Indonesia. 

Brought to you by Television's Senior News Anchor Timothy Marbun.

Dwell into a vast selection of topics, ranging from Pop-Culture, Digital Trends, up to Money and Business Opportunities by hearing it from the perspective of a seasoned journalist, and through talks with various interesting personalities found throughout Jakarta and beyond.

Tim has been a News Anchor and Broadcast Journalist for 15 years, and has reported major news events including National Elections, Social unrest in Thailand, Human Trafficking in Malaysia, and Massive Protests during the Arab Spring. Notable interviews include Palestinian PM, Twitter CEO, Instagram CEO, Coldplay, and Ed Sheeran.

Jakarta has been his home for the last 3 decades, after moving in from Norman Oklahoma where he spent part of his childhood. 

Tim also regularly moderates International events and seminars, including the IMF-World Bank Annual Meeting, Bali Democracy Forum, Indonesia-Africa Infrastructure Dialogue, and many more.

title: Double Deal - True Stories of Criminals, Crimes and Lies
description: My name is Lara Chicofsky, and my cohost is Nina Jobe. We created this podcast to shine a light on some of the lesser known characters and crimes in Boston and New England. We've spent the past two years researching the Boston crime scene primarily focusing on the 1960s. There are many podcasts and books available about organized crime in the Boston area, but ours is a bit different. I spent most of my life in my father’s world. Eavesdropping when I was a kid, listening intently when he was at the end of his life. I often took what he said with a grain of salt. He was, after all, a conman, an expert liar and an Academy Award worthy actor, but there was always a sliver of truth in his stories.

title: South Gate Intersections
description: Like many other cities in South East Los Angeles, the primarily Latino working-class community of South Gate is one that faces extreme environmental injustice. The city of South Gate is considered one of the most environmentally burdened communities in the state of California. This mini podcast series explores the many environmental hazards in the area including “The Brown Water Issue,” hazardous waste threats from many fronts including the Exide Battery facility, air pollution, and limited open/green space access. As climate change continues to progress, the urban heat island effect will only exacerbate and add to existing burdens. Covid-19 has further revealed and reinforced the dire need to address and take action on these environmental injustices.

description:

title: Distilled California
description:
Distilled California began as a joke. A historian and a distiller walk into a tasting room. What do they do? The historian says to the other. Do you know the story of the liquor that's in that glass? "No," says the distiller, do you know how it got into the glass in the first place? Do you know what it takes? "No," says the historian. And the rest is well...

Distilled California is the distiller-driven podcast for the booze nerd. Join hosts Dylan Almendral and Ryan Freisen as we take a deep dive into the bottle. We discuss the history, legends, politics and future of the California distilling industry from the ground up and distill what it means to be grain to glass in California. Ryan is a distiller and Vice President of the California Artisanal Distillers Guild. Dylan is a historian and writer. Both are devout students and stewards of the glass. This show exists to create informed drinkers. If you drink, know what's in your bottle! And, of course, to document the California distillery world while it is in its infancy. 
This podcast is for everyone; the aficionado, the vaguely interested, the distiller, the historian and the nerd alike. All are welcome and always will be. We all float down here. 

The podcast will feature tastings, science, history, interviews with distillers, book reviews, distributors, and of course, good times. 

Join us as we learn and pass on the experience to you! 

Please LIKE, COMMENT, SHARE AND SUBSCRIBE

title: Big Trip - Tracking New Connections
description:
THE BIG TRIP - A curatorial movement tracking new connections to the rooted practices and ancestral wisdoms around the world and linking them to a plural web that supports a more holistic global narrative.

We are a group of curators, each with their own skillset, combining to share and transform knowledge on three pillars: 

- Purposeful sound practice
- The pilgrimage trip
- The rituals of handing down

Drawing together specialists, practitioners, communities and curators from around the world, we are sharing stories through modern media – podcasts, online media, articles, exhibitions and ultimately a forum – to create artistic transformation through international exchange.

​​Four story snippets are juxtaposed and interwoven in this listening experience, providing you with a glimpse of first-hand interviews and completed narratives composed together by conversation setters and people in front of them.  Full-length podcast series will release throughout 2021/2022 on Big Trip online platform.

description:
Hey y’all!

I’m a God fearing, lover of Jesus mother of 2 {{birth}} 1 {{stepson}}
blessed wife of a handsome, hardworking husband.

Front Porch Diaries was created on August 26, 2020 on our front porch here on the creek of the Pamlico River.  Here on the porch, I have experienced despair, wisdom, faith, love, compassion, forgiveness, inspiration, hope and freedom.  But most of all God.  

Music is also my medicine.  It helps sort out all kinds of emotions that I may be going through.

I’ll be sharing devotions from inspirational women like Joyce Meyers, and reading straight from the Bible.  Share my testimonies, and stories, my life with my family- which is pretty amazing.  But far from perfect.  

My dream is to bring more people together through compassion and honesty and finding out who God truly created me to be.

title: The Stuff of Legend: Heinrich Schliemann's Life and Work
description:
Podcast series to accompany the online exhibition The Stuff of Legend: Heinrich Schliemann’s Life and Work. Celebrating the Bicentennial of His Birth. The exhibition commemorates the bicentennial of Schliemann’s birth (1822-2022) drawing inspiration from his vast archive at the American School of Classical Studies at Athens. Correspondence, official documents, his published works, ephemera, and photographs highlight the depth and breadth of Schliemann’s public, professional, and private life. The podcasts have been made to accompany the exhibition by offering a contemporary perspective through interviews with experts in the field of Schliemann studies, or readings from his archive.


Host: Eleftheria Daleziou, Historian and Archivist
Producers: Eleftheria Daleziou, Konstantinos Tzortzinis, and Natalia Vogeikoff-Brogan
author_name: American School of Classical Studies at Athens

title: Holly's Been Taken
description:
They found their sister's sneaker near a wooden fence. There was no note, visible sign of a struggle or an accident. But a 10-year-old girl who lived a serene, happy life disappeared in August 1993 while on vacation at her grandparent's house in Sturbridge, Massachusetts. On that horrible day, she and her baby brother took a 5-minute walk to see a litter of collie puppies play on a neighbor's property. Her brother returned home shortly afterward, leaving his sister alone. Then she was gone. No one saw what happened. Or so it seems.

Just before her disappearance, about 200 yards away, a man in a pickup truck leered at two teen girls, terrifying them as they checked their mailbox. They feared he was about to grab one of them. Holly Piirainen's remains were found 79 days later in the woods about nine miles away. The medical examiner marked it a homicide.

A team of retired investigators believes the man in the pickup is responsible for the abduction and murder of Holly, but her case is still unsolved. Three decades later, Holly's story has never been told in its entirety. With the cooperation of Holly's family, I decided to tackle the story of what happened that day. Let's discover what we know and don't know and who are the persons of interest. And...let’s be prepared to uncover some new details along the way.

title: Black America and Covid
description:
HOW HAVE BLACK AMERICANS BEEN IMPACTED BY COVID-19? 

Are you a Black American who has lost someone during the Covid-19 pandemic? 

Are you a Black American who didn't lose anyone and you want to share what it was like to work and live during the Covid-19 pandemic?

Are you a non-Black American who lost someone close to you who was a Black American and you want to share their life story?

Do you want to share your story about them? 

I'm a Black American; I'm an educator; I'm a writer.

I want to tell your story. 

I want to provide a platform for people to hear your experience. Your story matters. 

My mission is to give a voice and a name to the statistics that Black Americans are at a higher risk of infection and death due to Covid-19. 

I want to hear your unique perspective during the Covid-19 pandemic. 

If you did not get Covid-19, and you are a Black American, I want to hear how you felt about the vaccine, how you felt about the mask-mandate, how you felt about staying-at-home in 2020.

How can you share your story with me?

You can either EMAIL ME to schedule a time to speak over the phone or a digital-recording platform. My email is sonjakillebrew@gmail.com 

Or you can  RECORD A VOICE MEMO and email it to me at sonjakillebrew@gmail.com 

In your VOICE MEMO include the following information:
• Your full name
• What city/state/country you're located in
• The name of your loved one or friend or acquaintance
• Their relationship to you
• Their age when they passed 
• Their date of their death
• What you miss about them
• Something unique about them
• Something that defined who they were 
• Your journey with thinking about getting the vaccine or getting the vaccine
• Your journey with thinking about the mask mandate
• Your journey with getting Covid-19 or avoiding contracting Covid-19

Your voice matters. Your stories matter.

title: Floating Bridges
description:
In de driedelige serie van Floating Bridges wordt er opnieuw licht geworpen op Curaçao’s autonome status binnen het Nederlandse Koninkrijk. 

Tijdens hun onderzoek, gaan Lusette Verboom en Stephanie van Heijningen gesprekken aan met verschillende experts in hun vak, om na te gaan of de autonome status van Curaçao, ruim 10 jaar sinds haar inwerkingtreding, gevolgen heeft gehad op de politieke, economische en sociaal-culturele werkelijkheid op het eiland.

Het doel van Floating Bridges is om gesprekken teweeg te brengen en creative expressie te stimuleren over de ontwikkelingen op het eiland, zodat de kloof tussen kunst en werkelijkheid overbrugt kan worden.

Met dank aan  ex-premier van de voormalige Nederlandse Antillen en voormalig minister van Curaçao, Suzy Camelia-Römer, mr. Mirto Murray, prof. Rose Mary Allen, rector magnificus Francis de Lanoy en Dr. Rob van den Berg, voor hun samenwerking met dit project. Ook met dank aan Mathijs Reinen voor het beschikbaar stellen van de muziek.
Omslagillustraties door Pater Brenneker en Elis Juliana.

Dit project is mogelijk gemaakt door het Mondriaan Fonds.

title: PER UNA, PER TUTTE, PER TUTTI
description:
L’idea del podcast nasce qualche mese fa, dopo una chiacchierata con Mirko Romanato del Centro Sudi Ettore Luccini. Egli mi esortava a proporre qualcosa al Centro, lasciandomi carta bianca sull’argomento così pure sul mezzo con cui veicolarlo. Ne è nata l’idea di proporre una serie di puntate che avessero come filo rosso la storia delle donne in Italia a cavallo delle trasformazioni sociali e culturali degli anni Sessanta e Settanta. Ogni racconto può essere ascoltato singolarmente o costituire un tassello della storia complessiva, che non si pretende esaustiva -capirete, il tema è vastissimo- ma teso a offrire degli spunti di riflessione e fare luce su un tempo storico ricco di eventi che hanno ricadute profonde nel presente.
Le storie che ho proposto fin qui, derivano dai miei precedenti studi sulla storia delle donne nel secondo Novecento. Come spiego all’interno del podcast, il momento su cui mi concentro sono in particolare gli anni in cui iniziano a manifestarsi i primi segnali di una stagione di grandi trasformazioni che investono il privato e dunque il modo di fare famiglia, la vita domestica e le relazioni familiari. Il problema del contrasto fra tradizione e modernità in ordine al comportamento femminile è uno dei nodi problematici del periodo, sollevato ad esempio dalla stampa: penso alle vicende che hanno per protagonista la giovane Franca Viola, il caso del giornalino scolastico «La zanzara», il modo in cui sono ritratte le ragazze dei movimenti. 
I movimenti studenteschi e operai del biennio ’68-69 e il movimento femminista che comincia a costituirsi rendono vivo il tema delle rivendicazioni dal basso con una carica cui le istituzioni non possono più essere totalmente sorde. L’apporto dei movimenti è stato determinante per la volontà di delegittimare i modelli etici e culturali vigenti, soprattutto sul piano dei rapporti tra i sessi, dei sentimenti, della sessualità e della famiglia. 

Titoli delle puntate:
1- L'Italia che cambia (oppure Come cambia l'Italia dopo il boom)
2-Le italiane si confessano
3- La ragazza che disse no
4- Arriva il divorzio
5- Alla scoperta del corpo (delle donne)

description:

I will cover Roman history from roughly 68 through 117 AD. We will cover in depth the reigns of the Flavian emperors Vespasian, Titus and Domitian. Then, we will cover the reigns of Nerva, Trajan and perhaps venture into Hadrian, Antoninus Pius and Marcus Aurelius. 

To come talk with me about the podcast, make suggestions and anything else, go over to the subreddit that I've made for the podcast: https://www.reddit.com/r/96AD/.

title: Hawaii Abroad Audio Podcast #HAAP
description:
Aloha everyone, welcome to the Hawaii Abroad Audio Podcast.  This is a place where you can listen, learn and understand Hawaiiʻs place and people.  I'm your host Aunty Max. I was born and raised on the Windward side of Oʻahu, Hawaii in the Ahupuaʻa of Kahaluʻu.  I release 2 episodes each week.  Topics on Mondays, which I call Manaʻo Monday share Hawaiian culture lessons I learned from my kupuna (elder), Kumu (teacher), and kula (school) in Hawaii. On Fridays, which are called Aloha Fridays I highlight formal Hawaii residents by talkingstory with them about their relocation journey and experiences.  

This podcast intends to share the voices and stories of native Hawaiians, aka KĀNAKA MAOLI, and the Hawaiians of heart, that relocated away from our homeland of Hawaii.  My goal is to share these stories so we can all learn about others and understand the different situations.  Because the more we know the more we grow. 

Contact me or leave feedback at: hawaiiabroad.haap@gmail.com

title: Who Holds Up Half the Sky
description:
“Who Holds up Half the Sky” is an investigative podcast discussing the possibilities of advancing feminist activism in China under censorship and lack of free speech. Influential activist figures appear in China’s history from the Qing dynasty to the Maoist era with its famous quote: “Women Hold up Half the Sky”. But Chinese women have undergone much pressure from foot binding and arranged marriages to unequal pay and domestic violence. Over the years, I have dived deeper into issues of multiculturalism, social activism, and gender identities. This work defines my curiosity which stems from a continuous movement through distinct cultural spaces, which started in China.

You can read more about the podcast, and the research for it, as well as listen to the full interviews and the full-length podcast here: andreeacoscai.com/2020/09/09/sound-projects/

Cover art by Meaghan Paine
Mixing by Jullian Androkae

title: The Ballad of 18 Women
description:
Women in Action was an arts and heritage project, led by Collective Encounters in 2020-2022, that used drama and creativity to celebrate women’s resilience, activism and community organising across Merseyside. The Ballad of 18 Women is the major final outcome of the project, incorporating testimonies recorded in oral history interviews as well as poetic narration and original music and song. 

This radio ballad highlights the stories of 18 Merseyside women to give an insight into the incredible contributions women make every day to improve lives in our region. Woven together, they give a glimpse of the multitude of positive actions that hold, nurture and empower our communities.

The 18 women share a concern for fairness and social justice, but their causes, actions and impacts are many and varied. Some would not consider themselves to be ‘activists’, but all have given of themselves to help others and in doing that have made the world a better place. The radio ballad pulls some common threads from their stories; the archive collection (available online or on request) offers the full recording for each person, showing the richness of their individual contributions.

We hope the ballad and recordings will inspire new women activists, as well as sustain, celebrate and encourage those who are already working for change: it is a homage to these 18 women and to you.

Written by Sarah Thornton
Composed by Bethany Kay Hopkins
Directed by Tessa Buddle
Sound Design by Karen Lauke
Artwork by Doriscakes Creates

Featuring the voices of: 
Alma Brown, Anna Reid, Anne Gorton, Anya Chapman, Chantelle Lunt, Clara Paillard, Doreen McNally, Felicity Dowling, Imogen Woolley, Johanna Schweier, June Hudson, Keith Barber, Libby Mackay, Lois Woolley, Lynda Cash, Maddy Vaz, Margaret Mariette, Mary O’Sullivan, Olivia Graham, Terri Heldt, Tracey Dunn, Zi Lan Liao

For more information about Women in Action visit: https://collective-encounters.org.uk/projects/women-in-action/

To explore the full interviews with the 18 women visit: https://audio.maydayrooms.org/the-ballad-of-18-women 

Made possible with funding from National Lottery Heritage Fund, PH Holt Foundation, LCVS, Arts Council England, and Liverpool City Council; archived in partnership with the Museum of Liverpool and MayDay Radio.

title: WiHTL and Diversity in Retail Podcasts
description:
Welcome to our podcasts!
WiHTL and Diversity in Retail exist to support organisations to create inclusive cultures where anyone can thrive and reach their full potential. We have a mission to positively impact 6 million people from across both the HTL and Retail sectors by 2025. 

We create podcasts on a variety of diversity and inclusion topics with leaders from across the hospitality, travel, leisure and retail sectors as well as experts and advocates to support individuals and organisations to make meaningful change  

Thank you for listening and I hope you find our conversations interesting and enlightening. If you are interested in the work we do at WiHTL and Diversity in Retail and would like to find out more please visit our website www.wihtl.com and www.diversityinretail.com or follow us on LinkedIn

title: Liam Triforce
description: Hi, I'm Liam. I analyze video games in order to find out what makes them special to me. This podcast takes my YouTube videos and presents them in an audio format. If you're on the go and can't watch - now you can listen!

title: What’s Out Media Group
description:
What's Out Media Group started in December of 2017 when a group of college students decided to showcase creators they were fans of in their area, through developing relationships with these creators the organization has been able to set up interviews and working relationships with the creators they were fond of. What's Out is now focusing on producing original content while still showcasing  
and interviewing our Favorite Creators while branching out to other forms of content like Movies, Shows, Music and Documentaries.

title: Feeling Freedom
description:
What does freedom mean? What are the assumptions we make when we're commenting on other people's freedoms, and where does that come from? 

Join Vaia Gounis and Khalid Muhieddine as they embark on a global expedition to understanding what freedom means. Feeling Freedom is a conduit for stories to be shared and an exploration of the values and experiences that drive people from all walks of life to feel free. 

If you'd like to become a part of this journey, reach out to us at feelingfreedomstories@gmail.com, and let's take a closer look at the value, the right, the assumption and the lived experience that we call: Freedom.

description:
A series of interviews which delve deep into alternative ways of living and seek to understand what models exist to help us achieve an impactful life, on our own terms. The first season focuses on housing models with a large emphasis on housing co-operatives.

Produced by XTATX Studio: an audio-visual production company platforming impactful initiatives driven across the UK and globally.

title: Whatever We Want it to be
description: Hosted by Kory Kling, "Whatever We Want it to be" means exactly how it sounds. This podcast will evolve into what Kory and the listeners want it to become. We will dive into random topics and stories to explain some of the intricate processes we have in our society, or just to talk about random things that we think are interesting. Kory will objectively research and present, mostly in rant form coupled with humor, the information he has learned during the research process. Topics will vary tremendously as we scour the internet's information and put to use the fact that we have the ability to learn almost anything if we take the time to look it up. Mostly, we are just going to hang out and bullshit around while hopefully obtaining some form of interesting though probably useless knowledge or we will just have some fun...either way.

description:
Teresa and her Forever Friends who through trials and tribulations and many life lessons up to this point are putting it all out there. With my fellow Queens we will be sharing laughs, crazy stories, memories, the good, the bad, the ugly, possibly some tears and definitely a ton of Prosecco.

** Now you can listen and Subscribe on YouTube as well @ProseccoQueensPodcast

title: Where Art and Grief Meet
description:
Where Art & Grief Meet is an exploration of the space where the creative spirit mingles with grief, loss and adversity.

Sophia, a compulsive artist who has experienced her own fair share of adversity and grief, talks with a range of notable and passionate creatives (visual, writers, musicians, entrepreneurs) to reflect and share observations and responses to the question of how their art practice is impacted by the slings and arrows of a life, acknowledging of course that grief comes in an infinite number of shapes and forms: personal and global and everything in between. 

There is no hierarchy of grief here. Loss, in this context, is viewed as an inevitable part of life and a prism through which we explore artistic practice and expression. 
 
Sophia is interested in building a space where creatives can openly discuss their observations, their stories and the resulting strategies in order to alleviate isolation, make broader connections and create a supportive community. 


Website here https://www.sophandson.com/
Patreon: https://www.sophandson.com/whereartandgriefmeet 
Paypal: https://www.paypal.com/pools/c/8L9Ak8pJu3

A Tri-weekly Podcast made FOR Production Assistants BY Production Assistants.

title: Hitchhiker's Guide to Horror
description: Hosted by sibling duo Case and Kaely: Hitchhiker's Guide to Horror is a podcast intended as a means of horror storytelling, whether real or speculation. Be it monsters, murders, mysteries, aliens, the paranormal, or local legends: this podcast encompasses all things horror in a casual setting. Share your experiences on hitchhikersguidetohorror.com or on the newly set up subreddit r/guidetohorror. You can also email us at hitchhikersguidetohorror@gmail.com. We will go through all content and feedback. You can also find us on Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/hitchhikersguidetohorror/

title: Kings of New York
description:
On July 15, 1912, gambler Herman Rosenthal was gunned down outside of Hotel Metropole in New York City. His murder was "the crime of the century", setting off a chain reaction among politicians and criminals, while sending police lieutenant Charles Becker to the electric chair for having orchestrated it. 
110 years later, hosts Alissa and Annie aim to prove Lt. Becker's innocence as they explore new evidence.

title: Hiding in plain sight
description:
My truth, hidden in plain sight. 
I have been contemplating on what I should write, I am no longer searching the dark corners of my mind for material, mostly because it is right in front of me. 
People spend a lifetime hiding their most intimate secrets, ashamed or worried about what others may think of them; I do not have this luxury. 
The manifold that is my life includes so many once hidden treasures of emotional word candy. I use to believe (like most do) that I had to hide in the corner, face to the wall on my knees, arms bound with guilt and shame. 
I have been reluctant to start this new journey because my story impacts so many. Do I change names, do I alter the story, do I ask for permission? The first two are out of the question, the story would not be mine nor would it be true (as the title indicates).
I want to take a minute and describe the actors in my life, and I say actors as to me the relationship although real for the most part was fictitious.

title: Cracking The Vault
description: Three guys; Xander, Jake, and Trevor, crack open the infamous Walt Disney Vault to explore the history, story, and pop culture influences that each and every Disney Film presents.

title: The Green Path Podcast
description:
Helping the Vacation Rental industry become more environmentally friendly, one step at a time. 

We will show you how easy it is, and how cheap it can be, if not free, and share all the opportunities available. 

So join us each week as we take another step along the Green Path.

title: The Guestsplained Series
description: In the vacation & short term rental industry, the guest is the most important piece of the puzzle. Without them we have no business. But being business owners, sometimes we only see things from one side. With each episode, we’ll show you a look from the other side. Do you know what your guest thinks of the their journey, from booking to checkout? What do they really like? And what do they hate? Best to have a listen and learn….

title: Farming For the Future
description: A podcast aimed at people (especially young people) who want to learn more about, or enter, the farming industry but who are not from 'traditional' farming backgrounds. My aim is to have quick conversations with growers, business owners and inspiring individuals who have carved out interesting niches in the growing space!

title: Mickey is Dying
description: Medical professionals tell us that our friend Mickey is dying. (But he’s not sweating it.) This podcast is a conversation with Mickey as he candidly shares his journey with surprising positivity, thoughtful insights, and humor. Our goal is to help Mickey help all of us to learn about living while dying.

title: Ekta: Learning Differently, Together
description:
Welcome to the Ekta podcast, where we hear from students about how to foster unity and solidarity – or 'Ekta' – on Canadian postsecondary campuses. We take time out to listen to university students as they share their stories about what has made them feel powerful and powerless in their education journeys. We also hear their thoughts on practical steps we can take to create more inclusive, anti-racist spaces.   

  COMPANION GUIDES AVAILABLE HERE: https://ufv.ca/teaching-and-learning/inclusive-teaching/internationalization/multilingual-learners/student-perspectives/  

  Interested in discussing the topics addressed in this podcast? 
  Contact the host, Victoria Surtees: victoria.surtees@ufv.ca

  Are you a UFV student? Are you struggling? 
  Get help here: https://www.ufv.ca/studentservices/student-support-centre/supportive-services-at-ufv/

  The Ekta podcast is hosted by Victoria Surtees, Specialist in Internationalization at the University of the Fraser Valley (UFV), which is located in British Columbia on the territories of the Sto:lo people. It is produced by UFV's Teaching and Learning Centre and Sponsored by UFV International. The music is used with permission from a local artist, Saint Soldier.

title: Relax, we're only 30 & ...
description: Welcome to "Relax we're only 30 & ..." where 4 friends speak openly and honestly about navigating their way through adulting ( well, trying to!) in their 30's!

title: Web3 Demystified
description:
Web3 Demystified is a creative talk show featuring top innovators in the Web3 space, hosted by Vivi Lin. 

Vivi is an award-winning TV personality, crypto influencer, and media advisor. She works as a spokesperson and partner for Octopus Network (a Web 3.0 infrastructure), a columnist for Financial Times China, and media advisor for various blockchain projects. Prior to that, she was a bilingual TV presenter and producer for Reuters Financial TV and China's National TV.

Don't miss a single episode as Vivi speaks with the biggest names in the exciting, rapidly evolving Web3 space.

Follow Vivi Lin's Twitter
Twitter: https://twitter.com/vivilinsv

title: Obscuro
description: Bienvenidos to Obscuro, a podcast focused on conflict in Latin America, the areas most people forget

title: In a Different Way
description: In a Different Way podcast is designed to help individuals and families heal from the trauma of child loss.  Each week, a special guest will share their experiences of grief and their triumph towards healing and wholeness. Listeners will discover strategies, find hope, and understand that the life will never be the same; a new normal exist...Living In a Different Way.

title: Where's The Movement?
description: We will introduce you to people who have been apart of movements of God's spirit on the earth, past and present to catalyze you to a place of action as a Jesus follower in fulfilling the Great Commission, so that God will receive His maximum glory on the earth.

title: Avenues for Justice presents The Real New Yorkers
description:
Jenna, Cameron & Barri spent the summer as Summer Youth Employment Program (SYEP) interns at Avenues for Justice. During their internship, they learned to record, mix & edit, and plan their own podcasts. 

Throughout their journey, they explored many different questions, including:

WHAT MAKES A REAL NEW YORKER?!

Tune in to learn about Astrology, the War in Ukraine, What Makes a Real New Yorker, Chapters from an original story and MORE!

title: 760 FitPod
description: Get a deeper look into how 760 Fitness came to be.  Sheena and Tom Temple tell their story of how they became prominent community leaders and how they were able to bring 760 Fitness to life in the midst of Covid-19, adversity, and a whole community watching them.

title: La regola Tolkien
description:
La nostra civiltà sta attraversando una profonda crisi che può sfociare in un epocale trapasso culturale.

Cosa fare di fronte al concreto rischio della morte della nostra identità?

Di fronte al progetto di annientamento delle nazioni volto a instaurare un ‘nuovo ordine mondiale’, non si può che immedesimarsi nei protagonisti del capolavoro di Tolkien, ‘Il Signore degli Anelli’, i quali hanno dovuto aspramente lottare per difendere la propria esistenza.

Pertanto, ricercando le cause e illustrando le conseguenze della crisi civile e sociale che stiamo vivendo, nel libro si aprono nuove prospettive per dare un reale contributo alla causa della libertà e della sovranità nazionale, in modo da uscirne vittoriosi, proprio come è avvenuto nella trilogia tolkieniana.

title: The Botstiber Podcast
description: The Habsburg Empire may have collapsed following WWI, but the impacts left by the diverse multilingual state continue to affect the world, today. The Botstiber Podcast brings together historians, politicians, authors and more to help illustrate the connections shared by the various lands of the former Habsburg Empire and the United States.

title: Drink Smarter Not Harder
description: Recent LMU grads Lauren Giovannetti & Dominic Freitas dive into their life post grad covering all things when it comes to college, finding your people, sharing stories and lessons they picked up along the way. Tune in every week for a piece of their pregame, whether it's truth or drink, interviewing friends, job updates or a good old weekend recap, this podcast will bring you back to your glory days and remind you to always make time to have fun.

title: Epirus Falls
description: Epirus is a historical and geographical region in North Western Greece. A spectacular European secret of natural beauty, storied history and stoic people. Follow me as I venture through this land that has, for so long, been mostly hidden from the rest of the world. This is my love letter to a region that has stolen my heart, a document of its people and their passions, their pride in the community, and their hopes for the future. But more than that, it is also a journey of self-discovery, as I get to know a place, I hope to one day call home. This is Epirus Falls.

title: Golden Hour
description: Host Travis Card interviews icons of Vermont skateboarding, art and culture.

title: IDÍLEO EDITORIAL presenta: “A libro abierto”.

title: LifeWithHeather
description: Follow along as I continue through life and my beauty career. Listen to find out where I started, how I ended up where I'm at, and reflecting on past experiences. I hope to inspire others to do what they love and get what they want most out of life!

description: In a world where truths.lies,mystery and  conspiracy theories abound,Simon K delves into some of the greatest mysteries from the world of crime,ufology,science,myths & legends,religion ,the paranormal and so much more.Do you dare discover the truth?

title: Code 10-98
description: Code 10-98 is a true crime podcast that delivers stories about past, present, solved and unsolved mysteries and murders. You can also find our videos on our YouTube Channel. https://linktr.ee/code.1098?utm_source=linktree_profile_share&ltsid=6e70236c-3d15-4c8c-a21f-fa1de0ac3925

description:
A podcast about life in the security industry.
Stories from your favourite bouncers about your most embarrassing moments.

title: DeFoodRestation podcast
description: Is there a link between the food we eat and deforestation? What role do consumers play? The lungs of the Earth are under threat. There are many stories to be told and voices to be heard. In this podcast, the Young Fair Trade Advocates provide you with the most important information you need to know.

title: The Truth About Therapeutic Boarding Schools
description:
The troubled teen industry has altered thousands of people's lives, for better or for worse. Listen to the real-life experiences of people who attended therapeutic boarding schools and decide for yourself if these programs are helping or harming their students. 

This is the result of a study called The Effects of Therapeutic Boarding Schools on Minors.

title: Miodne Dźwięki - fabularyzowane dokumenty dźwiękowe
description: Miodne Dźwięki – projekt fabularyzowanych dokumentów dźwiękowych, traktujących o życiu odtwórców historycznych z okresu wczesnego średniowiecza. Bycie rekonstruktorem, to nie przebieranki a sposób na życie, zawierający w sobie ogrom wiedzy, sztuki oraz magii. Postaram się dla Was odnaleźć "To Coś", co przyciągnęło moich rozmówców do odtwarzania historycznego rzemiosła, obrzędów, muzyki czy kunsztu wojennego. :)

title: بودكاست تقرير
description: بودكاست حواري بطابع معلوماتي معرفي، يناقش مع مختصين، أهم التقارير والأبحاث التي تصدر بشكل دوري، وبخاصة تلك التي تصدرها (TRENDX) وحدة التقارير بموقع العلم

title: My Cryptid Vacation
description: My Cryptid Vacation combines investigation and adventure in some of America's strangest places. By road-tripping around the country exploring cryptid museums and tourist traps, intrepid host Clovis tries to get a handle on what makes these locations tick –- and what the folklore of these not-so-exotic locales might say about the country that produces it.

title: Hinkley Hi-Fi Pod
description:
I am an educator in Aurora, Colorado who interviews students, to get their perspective on modern day issues.  In a school that is in turn around and has had a rough few years of staff turn over to gun violence, this podcast is here to show a different side of our school.  This is my way of showing the world the amazing students that are out  there, in schools like ours.  Just because a school has a rough reputation doesn't mean there aren't amazing kids there.  We will cover topics including education, fun, gaming, sports, dating, and many more.  From questions from the teacher's children, to random topics, this 30 minute podcast is entertaining and informative.  Cheers.

If you would like information, have comments, or would like to help out email me at hinkleyhifipod@gmail.com

title: El Cardón Umbilical
description:
El Cardón Umbilical es un programa para Chureya Radio 107.9 FM. Se realiza en La Paz, Baja California Sur, México. Entrevistas a especialistas, activistas, artistas y agentes de la comunidad. Conduce Sandino Gámez. Con el apoyo de The Ocean Foundation. 2022.
*****
(El cardón es una de las especies de cactáceas más comunes en Baja California Sur, México. Puede soportar años, décadas de sequías. Durante los años 1970 y 1980 "El Cardón Umbilical" fue la manera jocosa de hablar de una ruptura sobre el regionalismo y folclorismo imperante en la literatura y las artes en la mitad sur de la península de California.)

title: On the Beat with Bambi
description: Your host, Bambi DeCastro Short, conducts lively interviews with folks from the southern Jersey shore (Avalon and Stone Harbor). She will feature restauranteurs, dog walkers, book club leaders, lifeguards and many others who add to the flavor of this wonderful 7 mile island.

title: Captain Jonny's Podcast
description:
Welcome to my podcast page! I am so glad your here to listen to my experience's though this journey called life. I try to have a new podcast every two weeks and it will be of my life and special podcasts about events. Also interviews of people who have though crazy events to over come hurdles in there life.  Any questions email me at captainjonnypodcast@gmail.com, also if you have some time and money. Please click on the donate money to help kids fight cancer(isaacstrongfoundation) a foundation near and dear to my heart. 

Thanks for your time

Captain Jonny

title: Keyhole Conversations
description: Keyhole Conversations is a podcast project intended to explore the thoughts, philosophies, and lives of all the people I find interesting. We dive deep into all forms of subject matter depending on who the person is and what they have to offer. From stories of peoples past, current struggles, or what they do to enjoy life, we cover it all! Many podcasting experts advise to go after a niche market to grow but we find that approach to be too constraining. So come along as we peer into the keyhole which leads to peoples minds and opens up conversation.

title: The Philosopher's Pebble
description: This podcast is by the podcast class from Sterling Classical School. This podcast is full of shenanigans because we are easily distracted. The Chrysler PT cruiser is a crazy 14 feet long! The motorcycle has a personality from Top Gun Maverick.

title: The Alba Cross
description: The Alba Cross podcast explores the connections between land, sea and people, through the means of sustainable and active travel to promote accessibility in the Scottish Outdoors.

title: The State Parks Project: America's Second Best Idea
description: A journey celebrating and telling the stories of the unsung heroes of our public lands, America's State Parks.

title: WildBrewed
description: Join me for a conservation chat over a cup of coffee. Explore topics like sustainability, animal species, conservation, minimalism and how to be a better steward of the planet.

title: Inside the Wire
description: Inside the Wire is a veteran centered podcast. Listen to Josh Buccholz, and Ray Kesler as they speak with each other or other guests about the impact of military life. A new series about the challenges of life, and how to get through them through the eyes of veterans regardless of the situation. We hope you join us for the stories from Inside the Wire.

title: Kinda Paranoid
description: Spooky girl talk, from true crime to spooky stories and everything in between !

title: Snacks Podcast
description: Rickard, Anton och Johan pratar om vardagsproblematik, resor, filmer och livet rent allmänt. Ibland med gäster.

title: KWOU Voices
description: Hear a variety of Western Oregon Universities student and staff voices along with community members as they create podcasts!

title: WORLD IN VIEW
description: World in View is a faith-based, current events podcast news program that looks at stories locally, nationally, and internationally.  It’s focus is on the Biblical End Times connections and how this affects your life right now and in the future. Presented by CIAR-DB Ark Radio's Esther McG and Ailean McG.

title: O CO CHODZI?
description:
Cześć w tym podcaście zastanawiam się o co chodzi. Czasem narzekam, czasem chwalę, wszystko zależy od wszystkiego. Pod lupę biorę interesujące mnie firmy, zjawiska ekonomiczne czy społeczne i analizując je w oparciu o badania, prace naukowe i inne próbuję odkryć jakimi prawami się rządzą i co to znaczy. 

Dla zainteresowanych odcinki są także dostępne na youtube w formie video.

title: SAVVY ASS VIBES
description:
A podcast giving you all the DRAMA, HUMOR and LIFE LESSONS as if we are on FaceTime with our besties. A small town girl just trying to speak to a big world and share all the energy. 

XO SAVVY

title: סוכני מוסד
description:
תוכניתם האנטי ממסדית של אוריין צ׳פלין וגל גרינולד.
שיחות עם אנשים מרתקים ומוזיקה טובה

title: Sunday Underground
description:
A new spooky podcast for fans of true crime, hauntings, conspiracy theories and all the other weird things your little macabre heart desires.  Join Blake & Kaleb every Sunday to talk about everything from heinous serial killers to UFOs.  We are in no way, shape, or form psychologists, forensic experts, or investigators of any sorts.  We are simply just weirdos that like the obscure.  These stories are meant to intrigue and possibly compel people to do their own research and look into the subjects further.  We hope you enjoy our take on the subject matter.  

***You may hear the podcast referred to as The Nightmare on 6th St. in the first couple of episodes.  The correct title of the podcast is Sunday Underground.***

title: My MS Journey
description:
Discussing everything that life throws up at me after, my diagnosis with Multiple Sclerosis (MS),

This will be a very heartfelt, honest and open chat.

This is all still very new to me, so, it just felt right to open up about my journey. In the hope that my story can help others.

I will try to be nothing other than, just me. That will mean jokes being made from time to time and being as light-hearted as possible. Believe it or not I'm actually quite a fun person...

So let's sit back with a cuppa and chat.

title: The Care Home Option
description:
Information and insights into the care home sector, delivered by experts who share their knowledge, experience and hands-on expertise. 

The Care Home Option Podcast Series, hosted by Gabriella Wills and produced by Drew Rice, is for those who are considering care and support options, and for those who wish to gain insight and understanding about care homes; how they function and the important role they have in keeping Health and Social Care working for us. 

Gabriella Wills, a nurse and social care leader with almost 25 years experience in the sector, together with her expert guest speakers, cover a multitude of subjects over the series, including how to select a care home, costs, funding and legal matters, complaints and safeguarding, dementia care and end of life care (see full programme below). The Care Home Option series provides listeners with both practical and general information. Whilst issues concerning regulations and fees are specific to England, most issues discussed are relevant to anyone considering care and support for themselves or a loved one, anywhere in the world.

Gabriella has worked to improve the quality (and equality) of life for those living and working in care homes, and presents an in-depth and holistic view of the sector, to offset the mostly one-sided reporting in the media.
Drew who is the creator, producer and co-host of the series asks the questions he feels would be helpful for himself and the listeners.

We are very grateful to all those who supported us during the making of these podcasts, especially to our expert guest speakers - Jonathan West, Romy Pikoos, and Padraic Garrett. To Caroline and Richard for sharing their personal experiences of care and to Daniella Wills, Paula Madden and Shelley Fish for their feedback, and to Shelley Wills Designs for the creation of the logo. 

The full version of the lullaby played throughout the series Co-written and Produced by Drew can be heard and seen at www.bettyndrew.com

Episode Program, to be released over a number of weeks.

Trailer

Episode 1 - Care homes; an overview.

Episode 2 - Choosing and preparing for a care home.

Episode 3 - Costs, fees and legal matters. Guest speaker, Jonathan West.

Episode 4 - Life in a care home, Part 1.

Episode 5 - Life in a care home, Part 2

Episode 6 - When things go wrong; complaints and safeguarding.

Episode 7 - Dementia - Part 1; Care - Guest speaker Romy Pikoos.

Episode 8 - Dementia - Part 2; Sensory loss - Guest speaker Padraic Garrett.

Episode 9 - Living with dementia (Part 3) - Richard's story; Caring for a parent during physical and cognitive decline.

Episode 10 - End of life care.

Episode 11 - Caroline's story; End of life care at home.

title: Education Rx
description:
Education has reached a tipping point: we cannot use outdated practices and expect students to thrive. Education Rx was born out of a desire to support change in the public education system. Education should be engaging, have real world value, and be equitable for ALL students; no matter race, socio-economic status, or ability level.  And, it should be FREE!
We don't have all the answers, but we are searching out experts and real people that hold a piece of the puzzle, and we will be giving them a chance to share their perspective on what is broken.  Then we will follow it up with what is WORKING! We want to help start conversations that will help us move towards educational reform that will move our nation's public education system forward.
The students of today are the leaders of tomorrow.  Education should be one of the MOST important institutions in our country! We can do better.  Join us. Start conversations.  WE CAN DO BETTER!

title: Understand Nostradamus
description: Much like Shakespeare or Homer, Les Propheties de M. Michel Nostradamus, also known as the Prophecies of Michel Nostradamus, reads like poetry but is actually an epic saga. It’s out of sequence, broken up into 942 pieces and mixed up like a jigsaw puzzle. With the jigsaw puzzle being a picture of a Labyrinth, the book poses problems but makes requests to raise awareness in an effort to create a different outcome. Skeptics will say that Les Propheties predicts too much Doom, but then why does one get insurance or prepare for calamity. Because concern should drive us into action and not passivity or depression. Nostradamus has given warnings and explanations for you in simple, easy to understand four line poems known as quatrains and once you learn to read them you can solve the puzzle. Skeptics will say you can interpret anything you want into the Prophecies of Nostradamus and that they are quite vague and intentionally that way to be able to fit general circumstances. Not true, if you understand how the Oracle works and that Nostradamus explained this in the Preface to his book of prophecies. That the vast majority of quatrains cannot be solved until after they have occurred is consistent with how the Oracle works. This leads you to learn the language so that you are able to solve the quatrains that remain, which are the main quatrains that pertain to what the book is about. There is one major prophecy that Nostradamus is making, the rest of the quatrains are merely proof of where he got the information. Each quatrain in the book of prophecies is not so much a prediction as it is a set of details about an event that took place in European history as well as events that affected the entire world from the year 1555 till the year 3797. Essentially saying to you all that he read your news and that's how he knows about this ultimately devastating chain of events; all of which can be avoided. Nostradamus laments in the Preface about the many “men of letters and letters” that will come along to make boastful claims of slander and bear false witness against him in an effort to sell books. He also expresses in the Epistle to King Henry II, his continual prayer to God asking that some people will come along to his Aid and Defense. Now that could be you once you have learned to read the quatrains. Nostradamus refers to this as the period when ignorance has been overcome, which needs to be now. The book doesn't only offer warnings, it also offers solutions. Nostradamus asks you to turn anxiety and reluctance into determination and action. Listen along to understand what it's about and why the book has never gone out of print for all of these years to make it into your hands now. The most famous of the Gothic writers from the European continent, Michel Nostradamus gives you the greatest literary work of prophetic wisdom to come out of medieval Europe. One of the secrets to the success of Les Propheties is rooted in the dark visionary style of his writing and how the quatrains actually create raw visuals in your mind. It was created as a word game after all because he knew people would remain more interested in that. Nostradamus insists that he is not a prophet and that he is a sinner like any man lacking perfection but he was given this information because he was at the right place at the right time. And the poetry? Well that was divine inspiration. History doesn't repeat itself, people repeatedly make the same mistakes because those who don’t study history are condemned to repeat it. Just keep going, strive on untiringly. It is in the doing that you will find yourself and the answers you need. Nostradamus says it's so! Love righteousness and hate inequity...while always remembering, there can be no truth entirely determined concerning the future. It's about what you do now; that's what determines the future.

title: Inside the Distillery at Cultivated Cocktails
description:
Listen in as we chat about our history, becoming a craft distillery, and sip on a few excellent spirits. This is the Cultivated Cocktails story as we know it so far. Documenting where we have been and the pieces that make us who we are today, as well as what comes our way as we go along. Join us on our journey.

As true natives of the Asheville NC area, the Howard family have raised generations in WNC. In 2012, they decided to start what was to become Asheville's first proper distillery to distill gin and rum since prohibition. With careful planning, research & development, and a burning desire to see Asheville become not just a beer mecca, but a craft beverage mecca, a distillery that would beckon curious drinkers far and wide was born.
A vision to bring a craft spirit with class to the table would soon become reality.
Over the years the vision has expanded to share the Cultivated Lifestyle. A new way to enjoy the distillery experience was created. From grain to garnish, Cultivated Cocktails takes you from the distillation process through the cocktail creation.

title: Life After. . .THAT!
description: What was THAT? This podcast will focus on survival and pushing forward after life events, tragic or not. Life after illness, Life after abuse, Life after a career, Life after whatever else happens! Season 1 focuses on the survivors of Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)--widows, widowers, partners, friends, siblings, children, etc. Each of our participants will have 2 episodes, the first being their story--Life AFTER the diagnosis, the onslaught of the changing dynamics of the disease, and how it changed relationships, and life. The second episode for each story will focus on Life After THAT monster and how they are moving on or not and what might help themselves and others. In other words, how are they now carrying on? ALS is considered rare, yet it kills tens of thousands in the United States annually and many more worldwide. Most ALS patients live 2-5 years from diagnosis, but not all. Regardless, the body movements die off while the mind usually stays vibrant. Most of those affected wouldn’t wish the disease on their worst enemy and would actually prefer cancer over ALS...because except in rare cases, there’s at least a chance to survive with the other. In either case, loved ones are changed forever, and suffer from PTSD, depression, etc. The importance of spreading awareness of the disease is important, but so is acknowledging what the caretakers and loved ones have been through. This season provides that opportunity, a sounding board if you will, and hopefully what my late husband, also a victim of ALS, encouraged...”Keep on keepin’ on because being sad or mad will not do you any good. Be happy.”

title: Friends of Markham Hill Podcast
description: Listen to stories about historic Markham Hill in the middle of Fayetteville, Arkansas. Markham Hill contains 300 acres of intact, urban forest and natural areas, several Pratt family-built structures, at least two Native American sites, and has a history of cultural importance to the area, including a boys & girls camp from the 1920s-1940s, hippies and students living in the abandoned camp cabins from the 1950s-2000s, over 40 years of University of Arkansas runners on the trails, wildlife studies, horseback riding, bird walks, etc. However, developers have bought almost half of the mountain so far and plan to deforest and develop it. Friends of Markham Hill is a grass roots effort to save Markham Hill from deforestation and development. But we need help spreading the word and using public pressure to protect this land. This podcast contains at least 80 'Weekly Markham Hill Moments of History' that were initially posted on Facebook, sent to the Fayetteville City Council, and aired on Fayetteville's KPSQ 97.3 FM Community Radio. So far, the developers and Big Money are winning. They have started deforesting. Please share this podcast and help spread the word. Thank you so much. Let's save Markham Hill!

Join us for new episodes every week and be part of the conversation on how we can make a difference in protecting our planet. Subscribe to Chronic Failure on your favorite podcast platform today. Episodes drop every Tuesday at Midnight.

Info@chronicfailurepodcast.com

title: Unbranded w/ MsDeanLovesYou
description:
Suzy Dean of TikTok and Instagram’s @Msdeanlovesyou explores what it means to start again. As a sixth year teacher, Suzy joined the myriad of teachers who left the profession and quickly found that for far too long she tied her identity into her work and her work into her identity. What she is left with now is an opportunity to rediscover the person inside who has been drowned out for far too long.

Unbranded offers community and comfort around a common question and challenge: “Who the heck are we and what on earth are we doing?” Join Suzy and various guests as she candidly explores what it means to “begin again” and celebrates the experiences and opportunities we all have to break away from what we’ve always known.

title: OUT
description: The OUT podcast provides a platform for LGBTQ+ people to tell their coming out stories. The series is meant to shine a light on the challenging and rewarding experience of claiming your identity, and celebrate a powerful unseen bond shared by those in the LGBTQ+ community. The podcast also aims to inspire and show solidarity to those in the community who are not yet able to come out. For some in the community, coming out is especially difficult. There may be safety issues, religious considerations, family pressures, or even a fear of death that prevents an individual from claiming their LGBTQ+ identity. Like the coming out experience itself, the format of the OUT podcast is meant to honor each individual's story. The interviewer allows each guest to freely tell their story without interruptions, and waits till their story is complete before engaging in a curious and genuine dialogue. Please enjoy the compelling stories of resilience, joy, and freedom in OUT.

title: Sfertul Academic  –  podcasturi de antropologie
description: Sfertul Academic este un proiect editorial digital care aduce împreună cercetători din științele sociale, actori și artiști ilustratori cu scopul de a populariza antropologia, oferind publicului larg acces la resurse fundamentate teoretic și înrădăcinate în cercetări de teren aprofundate, care de regulă au o circulație limitată la comunitatea academică. Apărută în anul 2020, colecția de debut a platformei Sfertul Academic reunește contribuțiile a 37 de cercetători din științele sociale, 13 ilustratori și 2 actori și cuprinde 40 de articole, fiecare dintre ele însoțite de versiunea podcast și de o ilustrație inspirată din conținutul textului. Temele abordate pun în lumină concepte centrale din teoria antropologică, cum ar fi: ordine morală, structură și agentivitate, cultură materială, relații de putere, relații de schimb, sisteme de cunoaștere, gen, identitate, sine și societate. Totodată, aduc perspective noi asupra unor subiecte familiare, de actualitate: mediu, migrație, inegalități sociale, privatizare, dezvoltare personală, turism, și altele. Nu în ultimul rând, dezvăluie lumi sociale mai puțin cunoscute, din România, dar și de peste hotare: Egipt, Ghana, Japonia, Rusia sau Abhazia sunt doar câteva dintre locurile pe care ni le aduc mai aproape cercetările incluse în acest volum digital. Celor 40 de articole publicate li se adaugă o nouă serie de 60 de materiale originale, pe același format: text, podcast și ilustrație, care vor fi publicate în intervalul ianuarie 2022 - mai 2023. Sfertul Academic este un proiect al start-up-ului de cercetare socială Antropedia, cofiinanțat de AFCN, inițiat și coordonat de Maria Rădan-Papasima. Coperta colecției este realizată de Alexandru Nimurad.

title: Hate No More
description:
Hate No More is the gripping tale of one man’s journey into and out of violent white supremacy.

At the age of 20, Casper was unjustly convicted of homicide and sent to one of the toughest prisons in America. He quickly got drawn into the white supremacy movement and ended up founding a skinhead gang together with four other men. The years that followed were filled with desperate fights for survival and a persistent quest to have his conviction overturned.

Eventually, while working alongside a Black man known as Old Man John, Casper realized that everything he’d been led to believe about race was based on lies — and he left both his gang and the white supremacy movement entirely. Even as his former comrades assailed him with death threats and labeled him a "race traitor," he began helping others leave the movement as well.

This telling of Casper’s life story ushers the listener into a dark world steeped in violence and hatred — a world few ordinary people can fathom, but one that’s a daily reality for those trapped within America’s cold and unforgiving criminal justice system.

For years, Casper sought to get his story out in hopes that it might save others from falling for white supremacist propaganda and making the same mistakes he made.

Now here it is.

Sound design by Michael Parkhurst at Nostalgic Innovations.

Prison cell image by Ichigo121212 from Pixabay.

Support us: https://www.patreon.com/HateNoMore

Follow us on Twitter: @HateNoMorePod

title: Als zwanger worden niet zo natuurlijk is.
description:
In deze podcast serie delen wij, Lis en Ruben, ons verhaal. Wij zijn al 5 jaar bezig om natuurlijk zwanger te worden. Dit heeft helaas nog niet mogen gebeuren.

Wij zijn geen artsen of deskundigen, maar gewoon een stel bij wie dit proces niet vanzelf gaat en ons verhaal willen delen. ​

Er gebeurt van alles om ons heen. Artsen die zeggen dat er niets aan de hand is en bij de volgende arts sta je al ingepland voor IVF en moet de baarmoeder per direct in een kunstmatige menopauze gebracht worden.

Dan zijn er nog vrienden die niet zwanger willen worden en het ineens zijn (oepsie), stellen die moeite hebben om ons te vertellen dat ze zwanger zijn en onze omgeving die het ons zo graag gunt dat ze overal van op de hoogte gehouden willen worden. ​

Maar wat willen wij nou echt? Gaan we mee met de maatschappelijke norm of willen we echt graag kinderen. Iedereen heeft een mening hierover en die kan soms je eigen zicht vertroebelen.

​In deze podcast luister je naar ons verhaal, onze twijfels, onze pijn en ook ons geluk. We nemen je als luisteraar mee in het proces wat we al gehad hebben en wat nog voor ons ligt.

Veel luisterplezier

Liefs Lis en Ruben

Kijk ook op: https://www.zwangerwordennietzonatuurlijk.nl/

Of volg ons op Instagram en Facebook

@zwangerwordennietzonatuurlijk

title: SPOON RIVER GOTHIC | Narrative of a Double Homicide
description:
Cory Zimmerman and Radio Vérité Present the Literary, Long-Form, True Crime Podcast: "SPOON RIVER GOTHIC - NARRATIVE of a DOUBLE HOMICIDE"

A True Crime Saga Revealing a Mystery of Romance, Obsession & Terror. The Borders of the Puzzle - Arson & Murder!

A HAUNTING TALE - The perplexing double homicide of mother and child unfolding against a vivid backdrop of a quaint, midwestern town—the story kicks off with the chilling discovery of Donna and Justine Tompkins' lifeless bodies in their fire-ravaged home on a frigid morning in January 1993. As investigators feverishly search for clues, the narrative swiftly evolves into a complex tapestry of characters with conflicting testimonies. With each twist and turn, the audience is drawn deeper into the shadowy corners of the victims' lives and a labyrinth of potential suspects. Through riveting storytelling, meticulous evidence analysis, and insightful expert perspectives, listeners are immersed in the investigation. Firsthand interviews are expertly woven together to vibrantly portray the victims' personas, lurking motives, and law enforcement's unyielding quest for justice. As the series unfolds, we are presented with a spectrum of viewpoints - from the relentless efforts of law enforcement and forensic experts to the harrowing experiences of friends and family forever marked by this tragedy. Amid these narratives, more prominent themes begin to emerge, which probe the essence of justice, the weight of communal bonds, and the ceaseless pursuit of truth. This true crime saga transcends a mere crime to solve as it morphs into a profound exploration of human behavior under duress, the resilience of people grappling with sorrow, and the extremes one will traverse in their quest for answers and closure. With each unfolding chapter, the sequence of events seamlessly guides us through a labyrinthine path of raw emotion as the intricate layers of the investigation peel away. Along the way, we are tempted, rather beseeched, to confront the shadows that linger beneath the veneer of our own lives.

Produced, Written & Edited by Cory Zimmerman.

Produced by August Olsen of Lone Bird Media.

Research by Jinra Ilustrisimo, Anna Maria Cannon & Chelseah Mesa.

Contact SRG at: cz@studios.works.

Visit SRG at: www.spoonrivergothic.com.

Their past life unfortunately caught up with them, landing them both in federal prison. They did their time, paid their debt to society and are now sharing their experience with the world; in hope to help people going through legal, financial or relationship issues. They are very raw on their podcast, unlike their known Youtube persona which is family friendly. Join Billy & Eva on BE Unfiltered.
