title: Doxxed The Podcast
description:
Join our private podcast feed with members only content here:

https://doxxedthepodcast.supercast.com/

Doxxed the Podcast, hosted by Jane Bonis and Roxy Renee, is a powerful and eye-opening exploration of the often-overlooked world of online harassment and targeting. With personal stories, expert insights, and practical strategies for healing and prevention, Jane and Roxy provide a safe and supportive space for those who have experienced cyberbullying, gang stalking, drama farming, smear campaigns, and doxxing. Each episode of Doxxed the Podcast offers a compassionate yet hard-hitting look at the devastating impact of online targeting, and seeks to inspire change within our society. With a focus on hope, encouragement, and preparedness, Jane and Roxy aim to empower their listeners to stand up against online harassment and build a safer, more respectful online community. From interviews with survivors and experts, to practical tips and resources for staying safe online, Doxxed the Podcast is a must-listen for anyone who has been or may become a target of online harassment. Join Jane and Roxy as they shed light on this critical issue and work towards a brighter, safer future for us all.

description:
TRUE CRIME FANS!

Did you know that currently over 14,400 people have died and remain unnamed, unnoticed and unidentified in our morgues and cemeteries across the United States?

These are real human beings, someone's mother, father, sister, brother or child and they deserve some dignity and closure for their family.

Did you know that Genetic Genealogy can be used to identify a person in a few hours, days, or weeks?

Join us as w work to get them identified using Forensic Genetic Genealogy and investigative methods.

WHEN YOU JOIN US YOU GET ACCESS TO

  • Learn about unidentified human remains cases that are unsolved near you.

  • Participate in our community to help solve these cases

  • Follow our Forensic Genetic Genealogists as they work to provide identities

  • Weekly episodes detailing new cases

At minimum, we aim to raise awareness for this ever growing number of unknown humans and seek your help to get the word out.

We appreciate you liking, sharing, listening and supporting us however you may be inclined.

Consider sponsoring a case, making a donation or saying a prayer that our work is beneficial.

Your Host: Christine Burke, Forensic Genetic Genealogist, Investigator and Law Enforcement Expert.

Thank you!

description:
The concept is simple; get a few knowledgeable industry experts from the cannabis space to ask the “GrowBot” ( ChatGPT) some questions and see what happens. title: Voci Rom
description:
“Essere rom è parlare una lingua in più, avere delle usanze in più, ma nulla in meno.”

Vi accompagniamo alla scoperta della cultura e della storia rom attraverso le voci di chi può illustrarci il mondo di un popolo che è rimasto fin troppo nascosto dietro il velo di un pregiudizio.

Una storia millenaria, fatta di cultura, arte e grandi uomini e donne, iniziata in India per poi diffondersi nel mondo senza mai riuscire a trovare un luogo da poter chiamare casa. Per troppo tempo etichettato come nomade e con termini dispregiativi, primo fra tutti zingaro, il popolo rom è da secoli vittima di innumerevoli pregiudizi, costruiti sulle fondamenta di una profonda ignoranza.

Spesso si ha paura semplicemente perché non si conosce.

Voci Rom è il nostro modo per fare contro-informazione e smontare pregiudizi, paure e etichette grazie alla voce e al contributo di studiosi, esperti e esponenti della cultura romanès.

Voci Rom è un podcast originale Art 33 - Cultural Hub

Con le voci di Elisa Scorpio, Scilla Di Pietro e Bruno Interlandi

Scritto da Teresa Coscia, Scilla Di Pietro, Bruno Interlandi e Elisa Scorpio

Da un'idea di Giuseppe Ruocco

Montaggio: Francesco Fele

Grafica: Roberto Todisco e Giuseppe Ruocco

Producer: Martina Romanello e Giuseppe Ruocco

Sono intervenuti: Gennaro Spinelli, Luca Bravi, Eva Rizzin, Senada Ramovski, Luna De Rosa, Sabrina Tosi Cambini.

Il podcast è stato realizzato nell'ambito del progetto "Non Chiamateci Zingari!", promosso da N:EA Napoli: Europa Africa e Art33 aps con il contributo di UNAR - Ufficio Nazionale Antidiscriminazioni Razziali per la XIX Settimana d’azione contro il razzismo.

description:
"Welcome to 'Here With Us' - your gateway to the inexplicable mysteries of the universe. Prepare to embark on a journey into the hidden realms of the paranormal, where things aren't always what they seem, and the unexplained is just part of the daily conversation.

In each episode, we plunge into chilling accounts of the supernatural, tales of cryptid encounters, and unparalleled stories of Unidentified Aerial Phenomena (UAP) and Unidentified Flying Objects (UFOs). Every week, we strive to decipher the undecipherable, challenge the norms, and answer the unanswered with the help of experts, eyewitnesses, and enthusiasts from around the world.

But 'Here With Us' is more than just a podcast. It's a community for those who believe, those who question, and those who are just fascinated by the countless enigmas that surround us. It's a space where the strange is normal and the unknown is embraced. We are the seekers, the curious, the brave. This is not just our journey, it's yours too.

So dim the lights, put on your headphones, and step into a world where cryptids roam, phantoms whisper, and lights soar across the sky with unknown origins. Are you ready to question reality and explore the extraordinary? It's all right here with us."

title: No Justice No Peace: The Broken System story of XoAlex
description: No Justice No Peace: The Survival of a Mother & Son in a Broken System Based on the True Story of Sarah Nazorek and her son Alexander Landon aka XoAlex who unexpectedly passed away in February 2022, he was only 16 years old and was fulfilling his future goals of being a Producer, Rapper, and Song Writer. His story is to bring awareness of issues among children and teens and help other parents and/or teens to be more aware of the systematic failures that can result in death and/or long term psychological effects. No Parent should ever have to bury their child or fight for their child to be protected from a system that should be protecting our children from abusers and drugs. His story is part of KeepNMalive.com. My son thought he was going to eat pizza with his ex girlfriend and her mother and he came home in a body bag. Be careful what you smoke it could be your last toke. Let’s change these laws and find everyone in our state who has been affected by losing a loved one to fentanyl poisoning. Also raising awareness that if a parent smokes a deadly substance with a child. There are mandatory sanctions if the victim is dead and cannot testify. Alex was due to testify against the first person who attempted to kill him through drug lacing. Unfortunately he was set up for death 2 months before he was due to testify. This real life story will have you hanging on the edge of your chair. Turning his story and my pain into purpose in changing the state of New Mexico and putting a stop to child abuse and systematic failures in place that hinder the mental health of our future. No child should have to go through failures of the family court system allowing them to be around murderers and drug traffickers. This story is the raw story of the injustices a mother has to go through to protect her child only for the child to end up dying at the failures of the system. Rest in peace to my precious babyboy Alexander. I will not give up we will change this system for future children. You lived such a painful life at the hands of humans who made it harder for you to just be a child and enjoy life.

title: Welcome to the Gospel Impacts Podcast
description:
Welcome to "Gospel Impacts," an engaging and captivating chat show where we embark on a thrilling journey to explore the profound effect and impact of the Gospel on people's lives. Get ready to be enthralled as we bring you a diverse range of fascinating stories shared by captivating individuals from across the globe.

In this uplifting podcast, we invite remarkable guests to join us for delightful and insightful conversations. These extraordinary individuals, representing diverse backgrounds and cultures, open up about their personal experiences, sharing how the Gospel has transformed their lives. Each episode is a captivating exploration of the transformative power of the Gospel, encompassing joyous triumphs and unexpected blessings.

Join us as we navigate through intriguing narratives, infused with laughter, genuine connection, and heartfelt anecdotes. Our guests, with their unique perspectives and journeys, will captivate your imagination and leave you inspired. Together, we celebrate the beauty of diversity, showcasing how the Gospel transcends borders and touches hearts in profound ways.

Our global adventures take us from the streets of bustling cities to the serene corners of remote villages. Artists, activists, entrepreneurs, educators, and individuals from all walks of life come together to share their captivating stories. Through their tales, we uncover the remarkable impact of the Gospel on personal growth, relationships, and endeavors.

With a lighthearted and warm approach, we delve into the intricate tapestry of life, exploring themes of resilience, hope, love, and forgiveness. Engaging with our guests, we delve into the challenges they've faced, the lessons they've learned, and the remarkable transformations that have unfolded on their spiritual journeys.

Join us on this delightful chat show as we celebrate the incredible diversity of voices and experiences, shining a spotlight on the universal and transformative power of the Gospel. Through laughter, shared wisdom, and meaningful insights, "Gospel Impacts" invites you to be part of a global community united by faith and the extraordinary stories that emerge from it.

Tune in, subscribe, and prepare to be inspired as we embark on a heartwarming adventure, sharing the captivating tales of how the Gospel has profoundly impacted lives around the world. Welcome to Gospel Impacts

title: Inform Your Consumerism
description:
Consumers around the world are inherently disconnected to the things that they consume every single day. In this podcast, we aim to unveil what goes on behind the scenes from the beginning of product's life cycle to the moment it meets us, the shopper, at the shelf. How does something start from a crop, or animal, on a farm, and turn into a product that's readily available for consumption? How are the planet and its people impacted along the way?

Our hope is that by informing consumerism during each episode, our listeners can make decisions that are more in alignment with their environmental and social values.

title: The American Soldier
description:
Welcome to "The American Soldier Podcast." A podcast to hear important stories told by Veterans and Military families. My hope and goal is that this podcast can help give a voice to our veterans and provide a path to healing, and help society better understand the sacrifices they and their families have given for us and our freedoms.

My name is Douglas Taurel, and I've been honoring Veterans and Military families with my solo show, The American Soldier. I performed a one-man show about ten years ago for roughly eight people in a small theatre in lower Manhattan. Since then, I've been honored to share the play and its message with over 45 cities and 35, including some of the nation's most notable theatres, like The Kennedy Center in 2016 & 2019, The Library of Congress twice, Off-Broadway twice, New York Federal Reserve Bank, and American Legion's National Headquarters, and earned a nominated for an Amnesty International Award and received 4 stars out of 5 at the Edinburgh Festival, Fringe for theatre excellence.

Because of this journey, I have had the honor of becoming friends with many Veterans and Military Families from every branch and generation who have trusted me to share their stories with you, hoping that it can help and honor their sacrifices.

title: Live and Let Live
description:
it's a weird saying "it is what it is", but for most of us, hearing it from someone; friend, family or co-worker; brings an almost sad sense of "they've seen some shit". A common saying among people, who at some point have or are on the verge of giving up, it's also a mantra of the strong. A sense that no matter what happens, things will work out, and somehow you will get through it. It is of course what it is.

​

Love sucks...so does everything that comes with it. The joy, the memories and the eventual breakup. Where the memories formed become a reminder of what you had, the plans and ideas you shared with that special someone sting more then ever; in a timeless void of "shoulda, coulda, woulda." Of course, seeing a former partner, girlfriend, boyfriend etc happy is all you really want at the end of the day. Weather its with or without you. While fostering and attempting to grow a friendship and keep the bond strong in whatever manner you can has its struggles and a daily reminder of what could have been, the bonds to friendship come with the same unique struggles.

​

This episode is my personal journey through a love found in the most unlikely of places (Grindr), to the good times and memories built, to post break-up and the daily struggle to split what was and what is. An hour long talk of how my former relationship changed me for the good the bad and the ugly, and the gratitude that I have daily that the individual is still in my life. Weather with me as a partner or friend. How do you deal with breakups and how do you; over time; numb the heartache and flashbacks of the small traditions, memories and things that make you laugh?

title: Living with Leukaemia
description:
Raising Awareness For ALL

Kicking Cancers Butt 💙🌈🎗️💪🏼

Remission 2/3/23

End of treatment date 27/4/26

Summary -

Monthly podcast.

A heartfelt story about 9 year old Archie, and his families journey living with Leukaemia.

Join us for the highs and lows and everything in between.

In this episode, Natalie discusses how she first saw the signs in Archie and how she attempted to find out what was wrong.

Appointments, living day to day life and not knowing what was happening, why and what to expect.

Speaking with doctors, balancing work and hospital appointments is one part of this story for Archie and his family.

This story not only affects Archie, who is battling everyday through Leukaemia but those around him and how they take each day as it comes.

We have Natalie, Archie's mum, Olivia, Archie's sister, Harry, Archie's brother, then Archie's dad, Baz, grandfather Colin and grandmother Michelle and everyone else in-between.

As Natalie discusses her struggles, losses and wins, we see an insight into a mothers side of the story and her pain to overcome the odds.

With each step, one door closes and another opens with Natalie, Archie and the family, when they eventually found out the news they weren't expecting.

This podcast will try to help those that may have just started their journey, at any stage or if it is a friend or family to answer any questions, fears and reassure and support those that may be going through this themselves or alone.

There will be links below for support groups and for further information on Archie's journey and linked charities and groups.

There will be laughs and smiles and not just doom and gloom. This is a raw, honest and open discussion where there is no taboo subject.

We hope you enjoy the podcast and join us on this monthly journey to document, discuss, answer and share Archie's story, Living with Leukaemia.

Links -

title: Podcast Vidas (In)visíveis
description:
Existem milhares de pessoas que estão por aí, todos os dias, andando ao nosso lado e que a gente não enxerga, pessoas que pedem um pouco da nossa atenção e que são ignoradas.

Essas pessoas são excluídas, silenciadas, apagadas da história e da mídia, têm seus direitos negados e suas vidas tratadas como verdadeiros invisíveis.

Nossa cultura, excludente e discriminatória, ensinou nossos olhos a não enxergarem os “invisíveis” e os nossos ouvidos a não escutarem suas vozes e, nós, temos seguido, enquanto sociedade, perpetuando este comportamento.

O Podcast Vidas (In)visíveis busca tirar o véu que tenta esconder a existência dessas pessoas e mostrar que a invisibilidade é cruel e pode destruir vidas.

Cada episódio vai retratar a vida e o cotidiano de alguns personagens reais que enfrentam diferentes desafios dentro do que chamamos de Invisibilidade Social. E você vai imergir junto comigo, na vida de cada um deles e vai ouvir suas vozes, para, juntos, entendermos o que é a invisibilidade social, como ela afeta cada indivíduo e porque ela não pode mais existir.

title: Ahora Oppenheimer
description:
El Pódcast sobre Oppenheimer.

Este pódcast contiene 4 capítulos en los que se tratarán cuestiones técnicas de la física y curiosidades sobre la antesala al Proyecto Manhattan. Está inspirado en la película de Christopher Nolan: OPPENHEIMER, que me hizo empezar a investigar sobre el tema hasta llegar hasta aquí.

En el primer capítulo empezaremos sobre la base, Desmontando el núcleo del átomo. En él veremos importantes nombres del mundo de la física teórica como Niels Bohr o Lise Meitner. Después de este capítulo introductorio iremos directos a una de las secuencias que pudimos ver en la película.

La pila de Chicago, mejor conocida como La Pila de Fermi. La construcción del primer reactor nuclear en el que se aceleraron partículas creando una reacción en cadena. Proseguiremos con Luz verde en La colina.

La colina era como conocían los habitantes cercanos a la zona de Los Álamos. Comprenderemos aquí la situación política de la época y la gran inversión económica en la que un proyecto militar necesitaría de los avances de la física para llevarse a cabo.

Y Ahora Oppenheimer, un capítulo en el que conoceremos más sobre la historia de este peculiar personaje. Su cara A y su cara B. Con él concluimos este pódcast. Sin más, te invito a que me dejes tu feedback.

Han sido semanas de investigación y profundización en el tema para poder realizar este proyecto, libros, artículos, podcast, documentales y películas para conseguir toda la información necesaria y recopilarla en estos 4 capítulos. Os pediría una ayuda, para llegar a más gente, si sabéis de alguien a quien le pueda interesar este pódcast, no dudéis en compartirlo. Para vosotros es un momento y a mi me ayuda a hacer crecer el canal.

Ahora si, con todos vosotros: Ahora Oppenheimer.

¡Gracias por estar!

title: Les chroniques d'Alain Foka
description: Notre histoire contemporaine a toujours été racontée par les autres. Au-delà de l’absence de média fort, notre tort est peut-être de ne pas fabriquer de contenu. De ne pas produire autre chose que de l’actualité. Si nous souhaitons faire entendre notre son de cloche, il est urgent de mettre à la disposition du plus grand nombre un contenu riche, sans complaisance et sans condescendance. Cet espace est ma petite pierre à l’édifice. Je le nourrirai avec ce que j’aurai fait, et aussi souvent que je le pourrai. Mais je tiens à dire que ceci n’est pas un espace de discussion. Et que cette page est ma page officielle, il n’en existe pas d’autres. Ceci est un espace de ma liberté d’expression où s’expriment des idées personnelles. Elle n’engage pas la chaîne qui m’emploie. Il s’agit de mon espace de liberté d’expression.

title: The world in a classroom
description:
"The world in a classroom" is a podcast about the experiences of young refugees, asylum seekers and migrant students in five European countries: Italy, Germany, France, Poland and the UK.

Have you wondered what today’s classrooms look like in Europe?

How do students with different background, languages and cultures learn in the same class and how do teachers deal with multiculturalism?

Stories of isolation and discrimination, inadequate education systems, but also stories of friendship, resilience and success.

Come with us on this journey!

"The world in a classroom" is a podcast produced by Excaliburproductionsltd

Hosted by Stephen Armstrong

Written by Marzia Minore and Carolina Rapezzi

With the collaboration of Ula Idzikowska, David Simantov Levi, Shirin Abedi, Agata Szymanska-Medina.

Music and sound design Rohan Onraet

The project was supported by JournalismfundEurope and mentored by Crina Boros

Some names have been changed.

description: Lara Garey & Mary Ward explore their journies in the context of being an ALS Caregiver and the Beyond. Beyond is the after of life of ALS when the person they are caring for has passed away. They are authentic in their conversations, strong in advocacy, embrace humor, and share BIG feels as needed. Mary has been caring for her husband, Tom, for many years, the last thirteen have included ALS. Lara cared for her husband, Tom, for six years, from diagnosis to death. Tom died in July 2022. Yes, each of their husband's names is Tom and they are veterans.
